project_request: Build a comprehensive user profile management system

questions.question: What's the most important action users should be able to take on their profile?
questions.rationale: Determines primary visual hierarchy and layout priorities
rejected_alternatives: Upload profile picture - important but secondary to data accuracy
Manage privacy settings - advanced feature, shouldn't dominate main view

questions.question: Should we use a single-page form or multi-step wizard for profile editing?
options: Single page with all fields visible
questions.rationale: Impacts cognitive load and completion rates
rejected_alternatives: Single page - too overwhelming with all options visible
Multi-step wizard - adds unnecessary clicks for quick edits

questions.question: How should users upload their profile picture?
options: Click avatar to trigger file picker
questions.rationale: Discoverability and ease of use considerations
questions.decision: Click avatar to trigger file picker
rejected_alternatives: Dedicated button - less intuitive, takes up UI space
Drag and drop - less discoverable on mobile devices

questions.question: How should we display privacy controls for individual fields?
questions.rationale: Balance between visibility and UI clutter
rejected_alternatives: Toggle next to each field - too cluttered, confusing in edit mode
Separate page - reduces visibility and discoverability

questions.question: What feedback should users see when changes are saved successfully?
options: Toast notification at top of screen
questions.rationale: Confirmation feedback patterns and user expectations
questions.decision: Toast notification at top of screen
rejected_alternatives: Inline message - easy to miss, doesn't stand out enough
Banner - too intrusive for frequent actions

questions.question: How should we handle unsaved changes when user tries to navigate away?
questions.rationale: Prevents data loss while respecting user intent
rejected_alternatives: Browser dialog - generic message, poor UX
Auto-save - conflicts with manual save button pattern
